availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Sullenger, Jr. (Woodford County, Kentucky, physician and farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, physician and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Sullenger and Elizabeth Sullenger. Married to Eliza Jane King Sullenger in Carroll County, Kentucky, on June 9, 1857. Father of Mattie K. Sullenger. Physician in Woodford County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Physician and farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Physician in Woodford County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 515B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Milville Precinct, p. 489A.
Consolidated List of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Woodford County, KY, July 1863, p. 76.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carroll County Marriages, Film 000414689.
